parallel.distributed
Class DAccessHashtable

java.lang.Object
  parallel.distributed.DAccessHashtable
public class DAccessHashtable
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a shared-memory-type hash-table that allows for distributed JVM process clients to access a hash-table for get/put functionality. The class supports multiple hash-tables identified by name. When key-value pairs are put in a particular hash-table, the key acquires a unique id, that can also be retrieved, but also serves to lock multiple keys at once. When a hash-table is created, its maximum size must be declared for efficiency purposes.

Note: The class should alternatively be called DLongJohnTupleSpace in honor of Linda's movie partner John Holmes.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

put

public void put(java.lang.Object key,
                java.lang.Object value)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
implements the classical operation put(key,value), with the twist that in case the particular key is locked, the operation will throw.

Parameters:
key - Object must be Serializable and obey the rules for keys in the standard Collections framework
value - Object must be Serializable
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if key is locked when attempting to put new value for it

lockAndGet

public java.lang.Object lockAndGet(java.lang.Object key)
first locks the given key and then returns the associated value. The lock is not released, until the method putAndUnlock() is invoked with the same key.

Parameters:
key - Object
Returns:
Object value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key does not exist

putAndUnlock

public void putAndUnlock(java.lang.Object key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
puts the related (key,value) pairs in the data-structure, and releases the locks associated with each key. If the key doesn't exist it simply returns. Notice that no check is made to ensure that the lock on the key was obtained before. The user of this class has the responsibility to make sure that this method is only invoked after a successful lockAndGet() operation.

Parameters:
key - Object
value - Object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

lockAndGet

public java.lang.Object[] lockAndGet(java.lang.Object[] keys)
same as lockAndGet(key) but works for multiple keys, which are locked in ascending order of their unique id, and then their associated value is added to the resulting array.

Parameters:
keys - Object[]
Returns:
Object[] values for each of the keys
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key doesn't exist

putAndUnlock

public void putAndUnlock(java.lang.Object[] keys,
                         java.lang.Object[] values)
same as putAndUnlock(key,value) method, but for multiple (key,value) pairs.

Parameters:
keys - Object[]
values - Object[]
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if keys and/or values arrays lengths don't match

remove

public void remove(java.lang.Object key)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
removes the given key from this map.

Parameters:
key - Object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if currently there is a lock on the given key or if there is a *get() operation under way, prohibiting the removal
